feed.title: Lareau Lab
feed.subtitle: The Lareau Laboratory for Computational and Translation Immunology is housed in the csBio Program at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center, New York, NY.

entry.title: New grant to study the human virome awarded!

link.title: New grant to study the human virome awarded!

entry.content: The lab receives its first independent grant to study the Human Virome from the National Center for Complementary and Integrative Health and the NIH Office of Director. This support will allow the lab to pursue its most ambitious research related to human viruses. Stay tuned for more!
entry.summary: The lab receives its first independent grant to study the Human Virome from the National Center for Complementary and Integrative Health and the NIH Office of Director. This support will allow the lab to pursue its most ambitious research related to human viruses. Stay tuned for more!

entry.title: Erin wins the people’s choice award at the MSK postdoc slam!

link.title: Erin wins the people’s choice award at the MSK postdoc slam!

entry.content: Congrats to Erin for winning the People’s Choice Award at the MSKCC postdoc slam competition. Erin presented a verbal summary of her work studying how the same infections can influence individuals differently, including HHV-6 that can be transmitted through the germline.
entry.summary: Congrats to Erin for winning the People’s Choice Award at the MSKCC postdoc slam competition. Erin presented a verbal summary of her work studying how the same infections can influence individuals differently, including HHV-6 that can be transmitted through the germline.

entry.title: Review paper on single-cell technology development

link.title: Review paper on single-cell technology development

entry.content: The first review paper from the lab is out in Trends in Biotechnology that explores key concepts in technology development for droplet-based single-cell assays. Congratulations to Arthur for leading the writing and framing this article! You can find the manuscript online here.
entry.summary: The first review paper from the lab is out in Trends in Biotechnology that explores key concepts in technology development for droplet-based single-cell assays. Congratulations to Arthur for leading the writing and framing this article! You can find the manuscript online here.

entry.title: Preprint on mtDNA variants and biases

link.title: Preprint on mtDNA variants and biases

entry.content: A preprint summarizing potential biases and artifacts in single-cell mtDNA sequencing data is posted on bioRxiv. Check out Caleb’s thread for more information.
entry.summary: A preprint summarizing potential biases and artifacts in single-cell mtDNA sequencing data is posted on bioRxiv. Check out Caleb’s thread for more information.

entry.title: Review on mitochondrial genetics and single cell is online!

link.title: Review on mitochondrial genetics and single cell is online!

entry.content: A collaborative review article written with the Leif Ludwig Lab is online today at Nature Genetics. The review summaries the rapid deveopment of new technologies for single-cell genomics that have specifically informed a new era of studying mitochondrial genetics. Let us know what you think!
entry.summary: A collaborative review article written with the Leif Ludwig Lab is online today at Nature Genetics. The review summaries the rapid deveopment of new technologies for single-cell genomics that have specifically informed a new era of studying mitochondrial genetics. Let us know what you think!

entry.title: Emma joins as our first summer intern!

link.title: Emma joins as our first summer intern!

entry.content: Emma Tran joints the lab for the summer as the first ever intern in the lab! Emma joints us as part of the MSKCC CBSP for undergraduate students. Welcome!
entry.summary: Emma Tran joints the lab for the summer as the first ever intern in the lab! Emma joints us as part of the MSKCC CBSP for undergraduate students. Welcome!

entry.title: Tumor ecosystems symposium
entry.content: The lab takes part in the U54 Tumor Ecosystems symposium at MSK. Caleb shared the lab’s work on PERFF-seq.
entry.summary: The lab takes part in the U54 Tumor Ecosystems symposium at MSK. Caleb shared the lab’s work on PERFF-seq.

entry.title: Erin Cumming, our second postdoc, joins!

link.title: Erin Cumming, our second postdoc, joins!

entry.content: Erin Cumming, PhD, joins the group as the second postdoctoral fellow. Erin completed her PhD at the Cancer Research Scotland Institute (formerly the CRUK Beatson Institute). Welcome Erin!
entry.summary: Erin Cumming, PhD, joins the group as the second postdoctoral fellow. Erin completed her PhD at the Cancer Research Scotland Institute (formerly the CRUK Beatson Institute). Welcome Erin!

entry.title: Single Cell Genomics Day 2024
entry.content: The lab debuts its work on PERFF-seq at Single Cell Genomics Day 2024 via a YouTube livestream. Thank you to Rahul for the invitation to present!
entry.summary: The lab debuts its work on PERFF-seq at Single Cell Genomics Day 2024 via a YouTube livestream. Thank you to Rahul for the invitation to present!

entry.title: 2nd Annual Probing Human Disease
entry.content: The lab presents its work in beautiful Cancun, Mexico at the 2nd Annual Probing Human Disease with Single Cell Technologies Conference. Thank you to the organizers for inviting us back to present!
entry.summary: The lab presents its work in beautiful Cancun, Mexico at the 2nd Annual Probing Human Disease with Single Cell Technologies Conference. Thank you to the organizers for inviting us back to present!
